name: The Hotel Hershey

reviews.text: We (group of 7 girlfriends) stayed at the Hotel Hershey in February for just one night - arrived for an early check-in and were given the keys to our rooms as well as Hershey full-sized chocolate bars for each guest. We were on the 9th floor. Rooms are very nice, beds comfortable. All of us utilized the Chocolate Spa for treatments and it is a very good spa, but usual pricey spa prices (my spa pedicure was $75 before tip.) Nice indoor pool and hot tub as well. They had a lot of different "chocolate-oriented" activites, for a price, which looked great (like wine paired with chocolate tastings), but we didn't have time to partake due to our spa appointments. Had dinner in the more casual restaurant - my food was just OK, everyone else really liked theirs, so perhaps I ordered the wrong thing. The Iberian Lounge is Breakfast the next morning in the Circular Dining Room was excellent - great upscale buffet and well worth the $17 price tag. Setting is lovely. They are currently in the midst of a huge renovation and I think the place will truly be 5* quality once that is complete. I would definitely return after the renovations.
reviews.title: Great for a girlfriends weekend away

reviews.text: My wife and I do not mind spending a little extra money to enjoy "four star" comfort. However, the Hotel Hershey falls incredibly short of all such highly rated hotels where we have stayed. After rolling our luggage 100 yards uphill to the reception desk, we checked into our dorm room (full apologies to my alma mater dorm room). Two double beds completely occupied the sleeping area, and the bathroom had no area for toiletries - and forget trying to manage two people in the bathroom at one time. From the time we walked into the hotel, no one opened a door or offered to take our bags to the room - assumed services for a four star accommodation. On the morning of our departure, twice around 9 o'clock, we were greeted by a knock on the door immediately followed by a "motel 8-esque" "HOUSEKEEPING." So, in the future, we will spend the extra money, fly to Dallas, Texas and enjoy The Mansion on Turtle Creek - a truly "four star" hotel.
reviews.title: Four Stars - Huh???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To celebrate our 44th anniversary I planned a surprise weekend at the Hotel. A few days before our planned visit, I received a call from the Connoiseur asking if he could do anything to make our visit more pleasant. That set the stage for a wonderful experience. Upon arrival we were greeted and given the key to an absolutely magnificent room. The hotel has an old world elegance and the staff was friendly and attentive. We had a wonderful dinner in the Circular Dinning room followed by an evening of dancing in the Iberian Lounge. Without hesitation I would recommend the Hotel Hershey to anyone.
reviews.title: Anniversary weekend

reviews.text: My husband bought a spa weekend for my girlfriend and me for Xmas. We went in March. My first impression was not a good one. While I was getting a tip for the valet parking, the attendent said that their was no charge for the parking but a gratuity would be appreciated. I knew from the sign, it was free valet parking, so I was reaching into my wallet for his tip. It was a put-off to be reminded that way. The temporary entrance was boring, but there was no sign indicating that this was a temporary entrance because of construction. Once we checked in, we were not told how to get to our room. The front desk just said there is a map inside with your key. We ended up wandering the halls looking for our room since there were so many additions to the hotel. Our room was just "okay." I would definitely not say it was a 4 star room. We found 2 stink bugs in our room. We were called 4 times to be reminded about our spa itinerary, even though we told them each time that we already knew our itinerary and to stop reminding us. We even got a call after our spa services were over. Our spa buffet lunch was mediocre. The wraps were dried out. The waiting room before the spa services were crowded and we didn't have a place to sit a couple of times. There was a beverage stand and we had coffee grounds in the bottom of our cups. The gym only had a few ellipticals and no one helped us with the equipment, headphones, etc. We had to fend for ourselves while the attendant spoke on the phone the whole time. The really get you with the spa credits. You have to spend for product in the spa. Be sure to get a receipt for everything! We heard a lot of people being told they had a balance when they didn't, and then it happened to us when we checked out. Thank goodness we had receipts for everything and it showed a zero balance. The bed and linens were nice and comfortable. The shower had great water pressure. The outlets nearby had some nice bargains. I would not recommend this hotel. The spa treatments were nice, but they seemed like an assembly line. If you go with another person, you won't see them. The services aren't not together. The locker room had a lot of accomadations. Bring your bathing suit for some of the shower spa services. The one we had, can't remember it's name, it was a woman sparying you with a hose while you stood in a stall. You felt like you were being de-loused. Strange. I never felt "welcome" in the hotel. We never complained about the stink bugs; I guess I got to the point I just wanted to get out.
reviews.title: Stink Bugs in Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room at the Hotel Hershey for a getaway for my husband's birthday. I was really excited about staying there because I had been to the spa and it was wonderful! To say the least, I was very disappointed with our experience. I asked for a room with a nice view and got a room overlooking the ventilation system, which was very noisy. The room was very small and smelled like it used to be a smoking room. When I walked into the bathroom there were hairs in the tub, which didn't inspire confidence in the room's cleanliness. When I made the reservations, I wasn't made aware of the fact that there are huge rennovations underway, which really takes away from the experience as well. (I felt like I was staying at a construction site.) I spent $300 on the room, and I would say it was overpriced by about $150. This hotel was nowhere near 4 star quality.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: I truly think if anyone has a bad review of this place it is either because of something odd that happened just to them, or they ar extremely picky. I will say that the rooms themselves are nothing overally special, just a normal hotel room, but the beds are really great. What you are paying for are the amenities-- nicely heated indoor pool that is staffed from 6am on that has lovely lounge chairs, a great gym that provides water with lemon slices and fruit, a soon to be amazing outdoor pool complex, and beautiful grounds. We saw koi fish, a duck family with babies and a frog on our visit.
reviews.title: One of my favorite places
The Kingdom of Snootiness
reviews.text: All the restaurants are wonderful, and they even have affordable breakfast options. Yes, the front desk staff is iffy-- but truly, how often do you have to deal with them? All the other staff is extremely nice, helpful and friendly.

Now, on to the spa which is like heaven on earth to me. They have an outdoor balcony, tons of amenities in the locker rooms, a gorgeous relaxation room with a fire and plentiful snacks, coffee and hot chocolate- all free! Of course you have to fill out a form for health reasons-- ALL spas make you do this. We were given ours on check in and were able to have it ready to hand in at the spa front desk. And you can also have a yummy buffet lunch in your robe at the spa restaurant.
reviews.title: Old World Charm, but at a New World Price

reviews.text: So, overall you really can't go wrong with this hotel for any type of stay, kids seem to have a blast, as do young couples, singles etc.
reviews.title: Horrible experience Would NOT go again

reviews.text: All I have to say about this hotel is overpriced and full of themselves. No one smiles, they all think they are too good to be dealing with you (especially if <gasp> you are in sweats instead of a three piece suit!), they are snooty beyond snooty and they are overpriced in every area. Someone needs to remind them that they are in Harrisburg PENNSYLVANIA. Not that being snooty is ever ok but c'mon, especially in Hershey it is not what you expect or deserve. And the Spa is not all its cracked up to be either. The wait is longer than it should be, you have to wait on line twice, once to check in, then they give you a form to fill out and then you have to wait in line again to hand the form in. And the woman talked the whole time I was getting my facial. I am not the kind of person who wants to "chat" while trying to enjoy a relaxing (and overpriced) spa experience.
reviews.title: Girls Getaway was Great!

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a stay at Hotel Hershey. While the hotel is lovely with respect to the grounds, it unfortunately attempts to be more pretentious than it is actually worth.
reviews.title: Not an elite, luxury hotel by any means!

reviews.text: Upon arrival around noon, we checked in. The front desk staff member, Tyler, was quite nice to us, apologized that our room was not yet ready and offered to put us on an advance check-in list where they would call our cell phone when our room was ready. We thought that was a great touch, along with the complimentary tickets to the Hershey Gardens, the Hershey Story, and a few bars of candy. Unfortunately, we never received a call up until the time we revisited the desk ourselves at 6PM. At the very least, we should have received a call around 4PM at the normal check-in time to allow us to go back if we wanted.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip for parents and children
The Hotel Hershey was outstanding
reviews.text: We ate lunch at the new poolside grill and the service was horrendously slow. We waited almost an hour for a platter of wings, a sandwich, and chips/salsa. The chips & salsa were stale and tasteless, the sandwich was good, and the wings were fantastic. Unfortunately, the wings were not accompanied by blue cheese dressing and we had to wait another 10 minutes for silverware and dressing. The server apologized, saying they had none at the pool bar which we found shocking as this was not a unique request. We waited about 15 minutes for our drinks which were nothing more than iced tea and water. The food was about average with respect to cost, but the service was just terrible.

We were lucky to score lounge chairs at the pool, but noticed many people running around trying to steal chairs and get chairs. There are simply way too few chairs at the pool. For the cost of the hotel, I was shocked that people were forced to sit on the ground or leave the pool area. They have cabanas you can rent for $200 per day that include lounge chairs, but I've never been to a higher-class hotel where there was a shortage of chairs. When we asked one of the servers/pool attendants about it, he just shrugged his shoulders and told us to keep our eyes pealed. The sad thing is that there is plenty of empty space for chairs, but none available. That being said, the pool area was incredible. They have a lovely pool for children and we saw so many happy faces. The water slides were great for kids and adults and the adult pool is relaxing and calm. The hot tub is large and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Worth the splurge!

reviews.text: We took part in a cocktail party hosted by an organization we were there with. The appetizers were ok with regard to taste, but nothing to write home about. Raw bar oysters, shrimp, and clams were not fresh and fishy-tasting.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back
Fabulous
reviews.text: This hotel is the only place to stay, however, you need to be very wealthy! If you are, book your room here! The hotel is beautiful, the service terrific and the hotel will arrainge to take to anywhere in Hershey you wish to go!

reviews.title: The Hotel Hershey -- A Classic Tribute to Grand Style
reviews.text: The Hotel Hershey is a magnificent hotel that is well staffed, well maintained, with beautiful grounds, a spectacular spa, outstanding golf courses and an overall great experience. The new addition to the hotel affords both a children's and adult pool areas that work nicely together and maintain the well appointed characteristics of the hotel and grounds. The rose garden is truly delightful and the sweeping views from the hotel are magnificent. The dining experiences are top rate and the wine selections feature some of the finest. The professionalism and friendliness of the staff cannot be beat. The Hotel Hershey is truly a class act found only in central Pennsylvania.

reviews.title: Kindercamp at the Breakfast Buffet
reviews.text: We didn't stay at the Hotel Hershey - we stayed at another local hotel, but we did go to the Hershey Hotel for the breakfast buffet in the Circular Dining Room. The Hotel is beautiful and impressive, as is the Circular Dining Room, the lobby is just spectacular and we were really excited for this special breakfast to celebrate our anniversary. The buffet breakfast is $17 for adults and $8.50 for children. They have a nice array and the food was very good - everything from freshly made waffles with fruit topping, to omelets (they have a cook making omelets to order), to cereals, pastries, eggs, meats, etc. We were happy with the food and the look of the hotel and dining room.

reviews.title: Not a great stay, but where else do you go in Hershey, Pennsylvania?
reviews.text: What we were not happy with was an encounter we had with the hostess. Despite the dining room being only half full when we arrived, she took us to a table which was located directly between 2 tables with screaming and out of control children. We immediately requested that we be seated at a different table, away from tables with small children. Well, from the look she gave us, you would have thought we had asked her to put us onto a rocket ship and launch us into outer space. She looked at me blankly for about 10 seconds as though she had never in her life received such an outlandish request. Once she finally grasped the request, she told us that they really can't sit us in a different location - and then went into a lengthy description of the hotel's policy in taking turns seating people in different areas in fairness to the waitstaff. So I repeated my request, emphasizing that we would not enjoy our breakfast if we were seated between tables of screaming children. So she left us standing there and went to consult with the dining room manager. We stood there for about a couple minutes watching her have this long, drawn-out conversation with the manager. Finally she returned and took us to a different table but she was not at all pleasant about it. She made it clear this was some big deal and we felt like we were really putting her out.

reviews.title: A Little Disappointed - A Little Over-Rated
reviews.text: Be aware that the Hershey Hotel appears to be loaded with families with small children, so if you are hoping for a sophisticated, elegant adult experience, you may want to go elsewhere. All around us were families whose children were behaving badly - one child (about 10 years old) was sitting on the windowsill playing with his shoelaces. Another couple children were playing tag around their table. Another child was singing at the top of her lungs. Not once did any parent or staff do anything whatsoever to stop the behavior.

description: A luxury resort with charming accommodations.
